    public class CoordinateRotation
extends Object

    Coordinate converter class rotating a set of coordinates.
    Author:
    Dieter Adriaenssens

        public final void setRotationCenter(Coordinate center)

        Parameters:

      • setScaleRadius

        public final void setScaleRadius(double scaleRadius)
        Sets radius scale ratio. Possible values : - value > 1 : scale up - value = 1 : no scaling - 0 < value < 1 : scale down - value = 0 : no radius (converted coordinate = rotation center) - -1 < value < 0 : inverse angle + scale down - value = -1 : inverse angle + no scaling - value < -1 : inverse angle + scale up
        Parameters:
        scaleRadius - Radius scale ratio

      • getConvertedCoordinate

        public final Coordinate getConvertedCoordinate(Coordinate coordinate)
        Rotate coordinates with an angle, around a center. A couple of transformations are applied to convert the coordinates : - to clockwise : a => -a - rotate 90° counter-clockwise : -a => PI/2 - a X = cos(PI/2 - a) = sin(a) Y = sin(PI/2 - a) = cos(a) - flip Y coordinate Y = -cos(a)
        Specified by:
        getConvertedCoordinate in interface CoordinateConverterInterface
        Parameters:
        coordinate - Unconverted coordinate
        Returns:
        Converted coordinate
